page.title: 02THE PARISH CHURCH, MILVERTON
page.content:
THE PARISH CHURCH OF MILVERTON IS CALLED ST MICHAEL AND ALL ANGELS. IT IS BUILT ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE VILLAGE. SOME PARTS OF THE CHURCH ARE VERY OLD. THE OLDEST PART IS THE SAXON FLOOR. IT IS A BIG SQUARE HOLE WITH COLOURED TILES AT THE BOTTOM. THE CHURCH WALLS ARE MADE OF A DUSTY PINK STONE CALLED SANDSTONE. THE TOWER WAS STARTED IN 1200 AD.
THERE ARE EIGHT BELLS IN THE TOWER, AND NARROW SPIRAL STEPS GO UP TO THEM. THE TOWER IS VERY TALL. THE LECTERN IS SHAPED LIKE A GOLDEN EAGLE. THERE IS A NORMAN FONT MADE OF STONE WITH A PATTERN LIKE A TWISTED ROPE ROUND IT. THE WINDOWS ARE MORE THAN ONE HUNDRED YEARS OLD. THEY ARE RAINBOW COLOURED, AND HAVE PICTURES OF SAINTS IN THEM. INSIDE THE CHURCH IT IS VERY QUIET AND PEACEFUL.
